title:
Spectral properties of Levy Rosenzweig-Porter model via supersymmetric
  approach
authors: Elizaveta Safonova, Mikhail Feigelman and Vladimir Kravtsov
abstract:
By using the Efetov's super-symmetric formalism we computed analytically the
mean spectral density $\rho(E)$ for the L\'evy and the L\'evy
-Rosenzweig-Porter random matrices which off-diagonal elements are strongly
non-Gaussian with power-law tails. This makes the standard Hubbard-Stratonovich
transformation inapplicable to such problems. We used, instead, the functional
Hubbard-Stratonovich transformation which allowed to solve the problem
analytically for large sizes of matrices. We show that $\rho(E)$ depends
crucially on the control parameter that drives the system through the
transition between the ergodic and the fractal phases and it can be used as an
order parameter.
subjects: Condensed Matter/Disordered Systems and Neural Networks
